title: Three managers who could take over Woodford Patient Capital Trust
text:
Neil Woodford has been sacked from his flagship Equity Income fund and the chances of the same happening on his own eponymous investment trust have just sky rocketed.

The board of the Woodford Patient Capital Trust has said it is continuing its search for a new manager. If the bookies took bets one would imagine Mr Woodford losing his job on this trust would be about evens.

But would another fund manager be able to salvage the wreckage for investors?

The trust has had a poor start to life. Its share price has fallen 65pc since launch in April 2015 while the FTSE All Share index – a broad measure of the London stock market – has risen 24pc.

Telegraph Money understands there has been a lot of interest...
description: Neil Woodford has been sacked from his flagship Equity Income fund and the chances of the same happening on his own eponymous investment trust have just sky rocketed.
